repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: A French-Tamil dictionary by Costanzo Beschi, copied at the instance of Edouard Ariel. Followed by various appendices.
Description based on the online microfilm.

extent.note: The leaves are broader in their middle than at their edges.

collation.desc: the front cover. Shelfmark on recto.
1 folio = front guard leaf. No foliation. Shelfmark on recto. Verso blank.
149 folios = French-Tamil Dictionary. Partial Tamil pagination. Partial library foliation.
1 folio = Title Page. No foliation. Verso blank.
1 folio = Front Matter. No foliation. Verso blank.
144 folios = Dictionary proper. Original pagination 1-228, 233-290. Library Arabic foliation 1-114, 117-145. lf116v has 228 à 232 as original pagination.
1 folio = back guard leaf. No foliation. Blank recto verso.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 216 (front cover, verso).
BnF shelfmark in black pencil: Tamoul N° 216 (f[1]r).

origin.origDate: Internal date. See colophon (u2, f[1]r). Dated to 1845 or 1846 by Vinson(1866-), to 1845 by Cabaton (1912), to 1849 by James (2000), on unstated grounds.

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

provenance.p: Owned by Edouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Edouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine (1912). Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois et malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 35.
Gros, François (1980). [Review of] A. Dhamotharan : Tamil Dictionaries. A Bibliography. In: Bulletin de l’École française d’Extrême-Orient 67: 346-358. — See p. 351.
James, Gregory (2000). Colporuḷ: A History of Tamil Dictionaries. 1st edition. Chennai: Cre-A. — See p. 109, 696.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. (1866-). Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 51r, no. 208 216 215.

Vinson, Julien (1901). Notice sur quelques missionnaires jésuites qui ont écrit en tamoul et sur le tamoul au dernier siècle (suite). In: Revue de linguistique et de philologie comparée 33: 1-48. — See p. 30.

encodingDesc.p: Transliteration conventions ― Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). ― Abbreviations ― c = column, f = folio, lf = library foliation = lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso.
